text: Abraham B. Yehoshua (, December 19, 1936 – June 14, 2022) was an Israeli novelist, essayist, and playwright. The New York Times called him the "Israeli Faulkner".Extra strong Yehoshua was the author of eleven novels, three books of short stories, four plays, and four collections of essays, including Ahizat Moledet (Homeland Lesson, 2008).A.B. Yehoshua's 'Friendly Fire' – The New York Times Yehoshua died on June 14, 2022 at a hospital in Tel Aviv, Israel from cancer at the age of 85.Abraham B.
